ARABIC: مُّهْطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِ يَقُولُ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: necks outstretched, eyes transfixed, rushing headlong to the Summoner. The kuffar will say, This is a pitiless day!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will hasten forward to the caller, gazes fixed. And the unbelievers will say: "This is the day of untold woe."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They shall be hurrying forth towards the caller, and the unbelievers (who had once denied this Day), will say: “This is a woeful Day.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: These disbelievers will say, "This is a hard day".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Rushing towards the caller; the disbelievers will say, “This is a tough day.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Hastening towards the caller. The disbelievers will say: "This is a hard Day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Hastening to the inviter. The unbelievers shall say: This is a hard day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: running with outstretched necks to the Caller. The unbelievers shall say, 'This is a hard day!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hastening toward the summoner; the disbelievers say: This is a hard day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: hastening towards the Crier. Those who deny the truth will cry, "This is such a hard day!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Hastening toward the summoner. The infidels will say: this is a day diffrcult.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: scrambling toward the summoner. The faithless will say, ‘This is a hard day!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Hastening, with eyes transfixed, towards the Caller!- "Hard is this Day!", the Unbelievers will say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Hastening towards the caller, the disbelievers will say: "This is a hard Day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: running (with their necks extended) to the Caller. The unbelievers will say: 'This is indeed a harsh Day'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Scrambling towards the Caller, the disbelievers will say, “This is a difficult Day.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:8] scrambling, hastening with their necks stretched out, toward the Summoner. The disbelievers, among them, will say: ‘This is a hard day!’, a difficult one for disbelievers — as is stated in [sūrat] al-Muddaththir, a day of hardship for the disbelievers [Q. 74:9-10].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Hastening towards the Summoner) to find out about what he is going to command them; (the disbelievers say) on the Day of Judgement: (This is a hard day) on them, that is. 627
